bill.title: Relating To Robbery In The First Degree.
bill.description: Amends the offense of robbery in the first degree to include a person committing theft or unlawful taking of a motor vehicle while being armed with an electric gun. (SD1)

referrals.name: Public Safety, Intergovernmental and Military Affairs

history.action: Prefiled.
Introduced and Pass First Reading.
Referred to JHA, referral sheet 1
Bill scheduled to be heard by JHA on Thursday, 02-24-22 2:00PM in House conference room 325 Via Videoconference.
The committee(s) on JHA recommend(s) that the measure be deferred until 02-25-22.
Bill scheduled for decision making on Friday, 02-25-22 2:00PM in conference room 325 Via Videoconference.

The committees on JHA recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 10 Ayes: Representative(s) Nakashima, Matayoshi, Ichiyama, D. Kobayashi, LoPresti, Lowen, McKelvey, Takumi, Tokioka, Ward; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Nakamura.
Reported from JHA (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 788-22) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.

Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1; placed on the calendar for Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Matayoshi, McDermott, Todd excused (3).
Passed Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McDermott excused (1). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 233).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to PSM, JDC.
Re-Referred to JDC.
The committee(s) on JDC has scheduled a public hearing on 03-22-22 9:31AM; Conference Room 016 & Videoconference.

The committee(s) on JDC recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDC were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Rhoads, Keohokalole, Gabbard, Kim; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Acasio ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Lee, Fevella.
Reported from JDC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3561) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-01-22.
Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 1). Ayes, 23; Aye(s) with reservations: Senator(s) Acasio, Fevella . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 2 (Senator(s) Ihara, Misalucha). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 585) in amended form (SD 1).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 385).
Reconsideration of action taken on 04-04-22.
Received notice of House reconsideration of action in disagreeing to the amendments proposed by the Senate (Hse. Com. No. 732).
House agrees to Senate amendment(s).
Passed Final Reading as amended in SD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Perruso voting no (1) and Representative(s) Hashem, McKelvey excused (2).
Received notice of House agreement and passage on Final Reading (Hse. Com. No. 741).
Transmitted to Governor.

votes.desc: House Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs: Passed, With Amendments
